trans-unit.source: Camera slots
trans-unit.target: Camera slots

trans-unit.source: Camera slots link the graphics compositor to the cameras in your scene. You bind each camera to a slot, then define which slot the compositor uses. This means you can change the root scene or graphics compositor without having to assign new cameras each time.
trans-unit.target: Camera slots link the graphics compositor to the cameras in your scene. You bind each camera to a slot, then define which slot the compositor uses. This means you can change the root scene or graphics compositor without having to assign new cameras each time.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to create a different camera slot for each camera. Instead, you can just change which cameras use each slot. The best practice is to disable the camera components on cameras you don't need.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to create a different camera slot for each camera. Instead, you can just change which cameras use each slot. The best practice is to disable the camera components on cameras you don't need.

trans-unit.source: !Note Each camera slot must have a camera assigned to it. If you have an unused camera slot, delete it.
trans-unit.target: !Note Each camera slot must have a camera assigned to it. If you have an unused camera slot, delete it.

trans-unit.source: You can't assign a single camera to more than one slot. If you need to do this, duplicate the camera entity and assign it to a different slot.
trans-unit.target: You can't assign a single camera to more than one slot. If you need to do this, duplicate the camera entity and assign it to a different slot.

trans-unit.source: If multiple enabled cameras in your scene use the same camera slot, the result is undefined.
trans-unit.target: If multiple enabled cameras in your scene use the same camera slot, the result is undefined.

trans-unit.source: Create a camera slot
trans-unit.target: Create a camera slot

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default), double-click the Graphics Compositor asset.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Compositor asset
trans-unit.target: Graphics Compositor asset

trans-unit.source: The graphics compositor editor opens.
trans-unit.target: The graphics compositor editor opens.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Compositor editor
trans-unit.target: Graphics Compositor editor

trans-unit.source: For more information about the graphics compositor, see the Graphics compositor page.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the graphics compositor, see the Graphics compositor page.

trans-unit.source: In the graphics compositor editor, on the left, under Camera slots, click Green plus button (Add).
trans-unit.target: In the graphics compositor editor, on the left, under Camera slots, click Green plus button (Add).

trans-unit.source: Camera slots
trans-unit.target: Camera slots

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a new camera slot to the list:
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a new camera slot to the list:

trans-unit.source: Camera slot added
trans-unit.target: Camera slot added

trans-unit.source: !Tip To name a camera slot, double-click it in the list and type a new name.
trans-unit.target: !Tip To name a camera slot, double-click it in the list and type a new name.

trans-unit.source: Bind a camera to a camera slot
trans-unit.target: Bind a camera to a camera slot

trans-unit.source: In your scene, select the entity with the camera component you want to bind.
trans-unit.target: In your scene, select the entity with the camera component you want to bind.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), in the Camera component properties, under Slot, select the slot you want to bind the camera to.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), in the Camera component properties, under Slot, select the slot you want to bind the camera to.

trans-unit.source: !Note The drop-down menu lists camera slots from the graphics compositor selected in the game settings.
trans-unit.target: !Note The drop-down menu lists camera slots from the graphics compositor selected in the game settings.

trans-unit.source: media/graphics-compositor-overview-2.png
trans-unit.target: media/graphics-compositor-overview-2.png

trans-unit.source: The graphics compositor matches enabled cameras to their appropriate slots each frame.
trans-unit.target: The graphics compositor matches enabled cameras to their appropriate slots each frame.

trans-unit.source: Create a camera and assign a camera slot from a script
trans-unit.target: Create a camera and assign a camera slot from a script

trans-unit.source: Use:
trans-unit.target: Use:

trans-unit.source: var camera = new CameraComponent(); camera.Slot = SceneSystem.GraphicsCompositor.Cameras[0].ToSlotId();
trans-unit.target: var camera = new CameraComponent(); camera.Slot = SceneSystem.GraphicsCompositor.Cameras[0].ToSlotId();

trans-unit.source: To change the camera at runtime, toggle the Enabled property.
trans-unit.target: To change the camera at runtime, toggle the Enabled property.

trans-unit.source: !Note Make sure you:
trans-unit.target: !Note Make sure you:

trans-unit.source: always have at least one enabled camera
trans-unit.target: always have at least one enabled camera

trans-unit.source: don't have multiple cameras enabled and assigned to the same slot at the same time
trans-unit.target: don't have multiple cameras enabled and assigned to the same slot at the same time

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
